answers.answer: In my opinion, she is on the way to hyperthyroid.  She needs to be around 1.0 and keep it there to have her symptoms subside.  I would find an endocrinologist who specializes in thyroid and diabetes and get a second opinion .

Her endo did the labs and didn's say anything about them being out of a normal range.  I was reviewing the labs myself and thought something could be wrong.  Could she be hyper but still exhibiting symptoms of hypo?  Should I cut down on her armour dosage?  I am so confused!!  Thanks for the reply, l read these posts all the time but rarely ask a question.

Sorry I could not get back to you sooner.  I have been both hypo and hyper,  and have taken armour and synthroid.  Some symptoms are the same either hypo or hyper.  I was on armour, 60mgs, and I went way hyper.  I had to quit the armour and went to the synthroid.  She is on a huge dosage of armour and armour is tricky as it can be inconsistent. I would talk to the doctor, tell him that you think the dose is too high and see if he will cut it back.  Otherwise, get another doctor.  This is far too serious and uncomfortable condition to have a doctor that doesn't know what he is doing.  Is there a reason she is on armour instead of synthroid?If you go to another doctor be sure to take her latest lab results.  She should be tested every 4-6 weeks or less as she might be sensitive to the meds. I am and I have been getting my labs done every two weeks to make sure I do not go hyper again.  I hope this helps.  Just keep asking questions until you get answers.  Keep in touch.

Thanks for the advice, I am going to call her doc tomorrow and question her labs.  I would have thought that if she was hyper she would be dropping weight like crazy, but her temps are still way low and  she struggles to maintain her weight let alone lose anyway.  I will keep you posted and I am grateful for your advice.  God Bless:)

question: My daughter who is 16 has type 1 diabetes and was diagnosed hypothyroid over a year ago. She is currently on Armour thyroid and takes 240 mg a day.  Her most recent labs came back at TSH levelof .01 and T4 of 7.4.  I am concerned about her low TSH and am wondering if anyone knows what this could mean.  Her dr. didn't mention any concerns or changes in her meds.  She is still exhibiting hypo symptoms- body temp very low and difficulty in losing weight.  Any suggesstions would be helpful.  ThanksAllys mom
title: help with understanding labs
